item.title: 8 Best Open-World Games Where Players Level Up, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Players level up in open-world games to acquire powerful abilities, making gameplay easier.
  • Hogwarts Legacy features talent points to improve spells & abilities, enhancing the gameplay experience.
  • Games like Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth and Cyberpunk 2077 emphasize leveling up to strengthen characters.

Open-world games are a blast to play for many reasons, with players loving the idea of slowly but surely getting stronger in their grand adventure. This is communicated in many ways, with the simplest one of the lot being the classic act of leveling up after getting enough experience.

This is very common in most open-world RPGs, with players loving it when the numbers go up and they become incrementally stronger. Usually, these level-ups are accompanied by the chance to acquire powerful abilities that make combat, stealth, exploration, and any other gameplay loop easier to deal with.

8 Hogwarts Legacy

Players Level Up And Unlock Talent Points To Learn Stronger Spells

Hogwarts Legacy
9 /10
77
8.7 /10
Released
February 10, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Fantasy Violence, Mild Language, Use of Alcohol
Powered by

Some players found the RPG elements in Hogwarts Legacy to be somewhat lacking, and hopefully, this is something that will be improved in the sequel. Still, it felt great to gain levels and acquire more abilities to make the new fifth-year student stronger than ever.

Talent Points could be used to improve spells, allowing players to combo magical attacks with a ton of flair and make enemies pay. With a high enough level, players can explore more of the Scottish Highlands, unlocking new areas that they were too weak to venture into previously.

7 Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth

An Open-World JRPG Is Bound To Feature Leveling Systems

Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth
9 /10
48
9.2 /10
Released
February 29, 2024

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
7 Images
Powered by

It's a given that a remake of a legendary JRPG was bound to feature a leveling system, and Final Fantasy 7 Rebirth didn't disappoint. Cloud and his allies embark on a journey for the ages in an open world after they leave Midgar, following the events of Final Fantasy 7 Remake .

Players must make it a point to get stronger and learn new skills to deal with the many threats that come their way. With enough levels and strong materia, the game's challenging boss fights should become easier as players use a bevy of abilities to defeat their foes in style.

6 Marvel's Spider-Man 2

Both Miles And Peter Level Up And Can Unlock And Upgrade Abilities

Marvel's Spider-Man 2
9 /10
51
8.9 /10
Released
October 20, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen Due To Blood, Drug Reference, Mild Language, Violence
8 Images
Powered by

In Marvel's Spider-Man 2 , both Peter and Miles are competent Spider-Men who can unlock skills from numerous trees that are either shared or unique to them and their abilities. This ensures that leveling up and investing skill points with one Spider-Man won't lead to players being frustrated by the inadequacies of the other hero.

It helps that the unique abilities in this game are a blast to play around with, compelling players to gain as many levels as possible to make traversal, combat, and stealth more fun. It's a simple system that plays it safe, ensuring that any complexities won't bog players down as they enjoy the tantalizing narrative and exciting combat.

5 The Elder Scrolls 5: Skyrim

Players Build Up Their Skills To Level Up

The Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim
9 /10
81
9.5 /10
Released
November 11, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M For Mature 17+ Due To Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Themes, Use of Alcohol
6 Images
Powered by

Skyrim is one of the greatest video games ever made, and it had a huge impact on the industry. It also changed the way leveling works from previous Elder Scrolls games to allow for more build diversity.

Simply using a skill is enough for players to progress toward a level-up this time, instead of forcing players to choose a few skills early on and stick with them. This ends up being a great way to let players build their Dragonborn however they want, and nothing stops them from focusing on other skills as they learn how this game works and figure out the most optimal strategy to clear dungeons and take out enemies in their own way.

4 Cyberpunk 2077

Each Level Helps Players Pursue The Build Of Their Choice

Cyberpunk 2077
6 /10
119
9.0 /10
Released
December 10, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content, Use of Drugs and Alcohol
6 Images
Powered by

Cyberpunk 2077 has made many changes to its progression systems since its release, although the system of gaining levels with enough experience remains constant. Completing quests and performing other actions in the world helps V become stronger as they try to get rid of Johnny Silverhand's engram before it takes over their mind.

At higher levels, V will have dozens of skills to bring into combat as they build up their perks and attributes, molding this merc in the player's image. In the right hands, enemies can become very satisfying to deal with as V uses his expertise to ensure that no one stands between them and their goal to save their body.

3 Elden Ring

Players Invest Their Runes To Help The Tarnished One Become Stronger

Elden Ring
10 /10
70
9.1 /10
Released
February 25, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
6 Images
Powered by

Elden Ring carries forward the same leveling systems seen in Dark Souls and Bloodborne . Instead of Souls or Blood Echoes, players acquire Runes that can be used as currency to either purchase items or level up.

Players must be careful while building their character in Elden Ring . Having a vague idea about the build they want to pursue will go a long way in ensuring that the Tarnished isn't completely ineffective against late-game threats, especially after a massive difficulty spike that serves as a potent mid-game skill check and punishes unoptimized builds.

2 Fallout: New Vegas

The Courier Unlocks Perks And Improves Their Abilities With Each Level

Fallout: New Vegas
8 /10
22
8.9 /10
Released
October 19, 2010

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Sexual Content, Strong Language, Use of Drugs
Powered by

Players will savor every level they earn in Fallout: New Vegas , especially if they're using mods to balance progression. Every level is crucial for them to improve their skills of choice, with enough levels leading to a valuable perk unlock as well.

All of this helps the Courier become more competent as they explore the Mojave, ensuring that players won't be scared off at the sight of Radscorpions, Cazadors, or Deathclaws after gaining enough levels.

1 The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt

Geralt Can Complete Quests To Get Experience And Become Especially Deadly

The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt
9 /10
55
9.5 /10
Released
May 19, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Use of Alcohol, Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Nudity, Strong Language, Strong Sexual Content
Powered by

While Geralt gains a decent amount of experience after killing foes, the bulk of the experience he gains in The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt is via quests. Players should try not to get too overleveled for a quest, since it considerably lessens the XP rewards they receive.

By efficiently managing quests, Geralt's levels can increase very quickly. Unlocking skills that let him use special combat moves, alternate forms of Signs, and imbibe as many potions as he wants is always rewarding, and players will relish the prospect of investing their skill points after a level-up.

item.title: How to Get the Sawblade Launcher in Dying Light: The Beast
item.description:
Dying Light: The Beast arms Kyle Crane with a host of powerful weapons that he can use to shred through hordes of zombies with ease. The Sawblade Launcher is one of these legendary weapons that players can get early on in the game if they're willing to travel into a higher-level area. The legendary weapon's blueprint is located atop the Silos safe zone, so be prepared to do a bit of climbing before being able to craft the Sawblade Launcher.

How to Find & Climb the Silos in Dying Light: The Beast

To get the Sawblade Launcher in Dying Light: The Beast , players must first reach and climb the Silos Safe Zone . The Silos can be found in the Pembroke area, towards the easternmost part of the map.

After reaching the area, players will spot a truck conveniently parked right beside the Silos , which will be the starting point for the climb. Grab the steel beam and use it to get across to the right side. From here, grab the metal frame on the exterior of the silos to reach the metal catwalk on the right.

From here, simply use the lamp post to swing across to a red pipe. Jump from one red pipe to another, which will lead to two more lamp posts. You'll eventually land on a catwalk, which you can jump off to swing at a lamp post, and later grab the rope to reach the second level of the Silos .

As soon as you reach the second catwalk level of the Silos, make sure to drop down the collapsible ladder . This will unlock a shortcut for you climb back up to the second level, skipping the initial parkour section.

Now, continue forward on the catwalk in front of you and walk the steel beam until you spot a rope to the right. Jump to grab the rope, and grab the red pipe afterward to reach the top of the Silos .

Now you'll need to restore power to the Silos Safe Zone . You'll encounter a lot of zombies roaming around here, which you can either eliminate or simply make a break for the electricity box. Attach the cable to the electrical box on top of the Silos, drop down the second collapsible ladder, and jump down to connect the wire to the box below.

This will restore power to the Silos Safe Zone, and players will be able to enter the safe area and get the Sawblade Launcher blueprint in Dying Light: The Beast .

Sawblade Launcher Location & How to Craft it in Dying Light: The Beast

Look for a wooden crate near the electrical boxes that will be blocking a vent passage leading inside the safe area in Silos. Break the wooden crate and enter the safe area of Silos.

You'll find the Sawblade Launcher weapon blueprint on the workbench , alongside other crafting resources.

Players will need the following resources to craft the Sawblade Launcher in Dying Light: The Beast .

  • 100x Scraps
  • 10x Blades
  • 3x Batteries
  • 1x Gun Parts

Once you've gotten all the required components, craft yourself the Sawblade Launcher and wreak havoc against the zombies in Dying Light: The Beast .

9.7 /10
8 /10

Dying Light: The Beast

item.title: Super Mario Galaxy Fans Think The Switch 2 Port Looks Worse Than The Original
item.description:
Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 may be missing some textures and details from past versions, according to keen-eyed Nintendo fans on social media. Footage of Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 was compared to the original Wii and Super Mario 3D All-Stars ports as evidence, although some have disputed the claims.

During the September 12 Nintendo Direct episode, Nintendo unveiled its plans for the Super Mario Bros. 40th Anniversary event, which included the title reveal of The Super Mario Galaxy Movie . In the same vein, Nintendo confirmed that two of the Wii's best-selling platforming games, Super Mario Galaxy and Super Mario Galaxy 2 , would be ported to the Switch and Switch 2. Although Super Mario Galaxy already saw a limited release via Super Mario 3D All-Stars , the upcoming re-launch includes Amiibo support, additional pages for Rosalina's Storybook, and an Assist Mode that can help players complete some challenging levels.

Super Mario Galaxy Ports Look Washed Out Compared To Original Versions

Weeks before the launch of Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 , some fans stated that the ports were missing some polish. In a post on the Mario subreddit, a user named RedditRedditReddit64 compared the upcoming Super Mario Galaxy re-releases with two of its past iterations via some screenshots. The pictures were taken from the September 13 Nintendo Direct, along with the Wii version of Super Mario Galaxy 2 and the Super Mario 3D All-Stars port of Super Mario Galaxy . In Super Mario Galaxy 2 's Boulder Bowl Galaxy, some details of a metal bridge that could be seen on the Wii version were missing from the upcoming Switch version, as the latter's textures appeared flat.

Additionally, some of the ground textures in the Super Mario 3D All-Stars version of Super Mario Galaxy 's Good Egg Galaxy level appeared more detailed compared to the Switch 2 version. However, the water and grass details of Super Mario Galaxy on the Switch 2 stood out a bit more than the previous port. While some fans questioned Nintendo's attention to detail, others pointed out that the footage shown during the September 12 Nintendo Direct may not be indicative of the final product. Ergo, the comparisons must be taken with a grain of salt.

Between the inconsistent textures and the $70 price tag of Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2 , the upcoming remakes have already stirred controversy among Mario fans. It remains to be seen how the final versions of the Super Mario Galaxy re-releases will turn out.

Super Mario Galaxy + Super Mario Galaxy 2

item.title: Games Where You Have To Translate Alien Languages
item.description:
Symbols that cant be understood have always captivated human imagination, especially when they tell a story. Some games lean into this captivation by asking players to decipher alien imagination, going beyond the usual dialogue box or quest marker. They invite curiosity and reward patience, letting players roleplay an archaeologist uncovering the secrets of a foreign civilization.

Here are seven games that take the idea in a different direction, whether it be with elegance or humor, but always capturing the same joy of turning something incomprehensible into an engaging story.

Heaven's Vault

Every Word Feels Like Archaeology

Heaven's Vault
8.0 /10
Released
April 15, 2019

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
T For Teen: Suggestive Themes
Developer(s)
inkle studios
Platform(s)
Steam, Nintendo Switch, PlayStation 4
Powered by

Heavens Vault treats language like treasure. As an archaeologist named Aliya, players uncover fragments of an ancient language across Nebulas ruins. Each symbol can be pieced together with context, forcing players to test hypotheses rather than solving square goes in square hole puzzles. Its possible to guess wrong, and that misinterpretation ripples through into future translation, creating a sense of discovery where even mistakes carry weight.

What makes it special is how those translations directly tie into storytelling. The history of Nebula feels uncertain, subjective, and ever-changing, as if the language itself is shaping your perception of the past. Theres no single correct answer, just a growing dictionary of meanings that feel as fragile as the artifacts you study.

Outer Wilds: Echoes of the Eye

When Language Lives in Shadows

The base game of Outer Wilds already has plenty of language-solving, but the Echoes of the Eye takes it to another level. Centered around communication without words, the Nomai left behind murals and slideshows, forcing players to interpret flickering images in dark hallways and projection rooms. Its the perfect example of show, dont tell storytelling, where silence speaks louder than any dialogue.

Its not just about learning lore either; understanding the fears, rituals, and secrets of the alien people unlocks the way forward. It ends up creating moments where understanding a symbol or recognizing a reused pattern feels more satisfying than opening any locked door.

Fez

Cracking The Code Of A Hidden Language

Fez
10 /10
8.0 /10
Released
April 13, 2012

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E For Everyone due to Mild Fantasy Violence
Developer(s)
Polytron Corporation
Platform(s)
PC, PS3, PS4, PS Vita, Switch, Xbox 360, iOS
Powered by

Though it appears to be a simple puzzle game at a glance, Fez hides an entire foreign alphabet in plain sight. Initially, the glyphs painted on walls and stones look to be no more than decorative flourishes, but attentive players find that they reveal themselves as a fully functional language. Players had to piece together an entire cipher to make sense of the worlds secrets, and community forums were buzzing as new discoveries kept unraveling deeper layers of the game.

Whats striking is how natural it feels once decrypted. Suddenly, those strange patterns stop being random symbols and start to communicate real messages. Transforming exploration from platforming into linguistic archaeology, making Fez one of the rare games where solving the language is the key to understanding the games world itself.

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic

When Aliens Speak in Sith Tongues

Star Wars: Knights of the Old Republic
12
9.1 /10
Released
July 15, 2003

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Violence
Developer(s)
BioWare
Platform(s)
Xbox (Original), iOS, Android, Switch, PC, macOS
Powered by

Making alien language part of its role-playing depth, Knights of the Old Republic s Twileks, Ithorians, and growling Wookies arent just background NPCs making incomprehensible noise. Their untranslated dialogue forces players to rely on context, tone, and the occasional droid as an interpreter.

Though it isnt a system requiring players to painstakingly crack codes, it does capture the immersion of a galaxy full of diverse languages. It makes you feel like a visitor in unfamiliar cultures, and every translation moment reinforces the scope of the Star Wars universe. The language barrier is sometimes tense, other times humorous, but always flavorful.

Journey to the Savage Planet

Cracking Jokes in an Alien Dialect

Journey to the Savage Planet
9 /10
Released
January 28, 2020

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen due to Blood and Gore, Crude Humor, Language, Use of Drugs, Violence
Developer(s)
Typhoon Studios
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, Stadia, Xbox One
Powered by

Taking a more comedic route, Journey to the Savage Planet makes even its flora and fauna absurd, let alone the way it toys with alien communication. While scanning strange creatures and plants, the commentary about them riffs on the absurdity of trying to make sense of things that are nonsensical to begin with.

The act of translating here is about interpreting the environment through goofy corporate jargon and deliberately unhelpful analysis tools. Instead of reverent or profound, it treats alien language as something ridiculous and overwhelming. Its the perfect satire of language barriers in the form of slapstick sci-fi.

Subnautica

The Sea Speaks Silent Words

Subnautica
13
9.2 /10
Released
January 23, 2018

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
E10+ for Everyone 10+: Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Developer(s)
Unknown Worlds Entertainment
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, PlayStation 4, PlayStation 5, Xbox One, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Subnautica is primarily remembered for its survival tension and gutwrenching ocean depths, but it also hides an alien language woven into the ruins of the Precursors. Strange symbols and artifacts are scattered throughout the world, which hint at their advanced technology and struggle with the Kharaa infection. Instead of giving any neat translations, the game relies on its environmental storytelling and scattered logs to aid you in interpretation through context.

The unknown language only deepens the sense of isolation on this alien planet with no land mass. Youre not just a lone survivor, but an outsider decoding scraps of a civilization that was far more advanced. Each ruin players visit feels like uncovering a story, a reminder that in Subnautica , the ocean is full of alien voices.

Chants of Sennaar

Decoding the Tower of Babel

Chants of Sennaar
8.0 /10
Released
September 5, 2023

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
Everyone 10+
Developer(s)
Rundisc
Platform(s)
Nintendo Switch, PC, Xbox One, PlayStation 4
6 Images
Powered by

Putting a language puzzle twist on the age-old story of Babel, Chants of Sennaar has players take control of a lone traveler ascending a massive tower filled with isolated cultures, each speaking a tongue that cant quite be comprehended. The entire experience is built around carefully observing, listening, and scribbling down notes as you slowly piece together meaning from symbols and context.

Every breakthrough feels earned, and thats what makes it so gripping. Spotting a word youve seen before on a door and in a conversation gives the same satisfaction as unraveling some secret code. The game doesnt bother with combat or flashy skill trees, just pure linguistic discovery. By the time players are bridging communication between groups who cant understand each other, it feels like going from a confused outsider to the interpreter holding the entire tower together.

item.title: Why Ash Could Never Survive The Pokemon Games
item.description:
In Japan, Pokemon fans had to wait a year after the games debuted for the TV show. But, in North America, the games, cards, and anime all debuted together in 1998 in one solid stream of marketing. It was more than parents could handle, but the kids were over the moon to collect the cards, watch the anime, and play the games.

Every episode brought Ash and his friends closer together, between winning battles, catching Pokemon, and having a good old laugh. For anime protagonists, Ash seemed like he was all there. He struggled to be a Pokemon Master so much so that savvy video game players probably thought they could beat Ash in a duel. So, how bad would Ash do if he had to play by the rules of the Pokemon games instead of the anime?

No Party To Fall Back On

Misty And Brock Are Rivals

In the anime, Ash quickly befriends Misty, followed by Brock after proving himself at his Gym. Thanks to their help, Ash learns a lot about how to treat people and gets to fall back on them if he needs help in battle. Brock is also a great cook who feeds the others and the Pokemon. The party changes between seasons, but for many fans, Misty and Brock are the classic characters that complete the trio.

In the games, players are by themselves. In the later games, sometimes a rival or random character will join the player for a certain area of the game. For the most part, this means Ash cannot rely on a party to carry him like in other turn-based RPG systems. How far can he actually get alone?

Gym Leaders Mean Business

No Sympathy Badges

Gym battles in the Pokemon games are serious business. Players will have to face underlings before they get to the master, and if they plan well, they can outmatch them. For example, Blaine in Pokemon Red and Pokemon Blue likes Fire-type Pokemon, so a good party of Water-type Pokemon would do the trick.

Ash isnt really a strategist when it comes to Gym battles. If he sees a certain Pokemon type emerge, he may be smart enough to use the effective element against them. Then again, his roster isnt as well-crafted. Also, sometimes, just for trying, Leaders basically give Ash a consolation badge like the Sabrina arc in Saffron City. To win, Ash would need to become the very best, and his lackluster hunger towards training wouldnt net him many badges.

His Reliance On Pikachu Is Not Going To Work Out

Electricity Is Not A Versatile Element

Another problem of Ashs is his friendship with Pikachu. Its honestly one of the most charming things about the anime as the two get along swimmingly. Pikachu tries hard for Ash, even in impossible setups like going against Rock-types and Ground-types against Brock, even though Pikachu is weak to those elements.

By the grace of the Pokemon gods somehow water from sprinkler systems allowed Pikachu to electrocute Onix. It doesnt work like that in the games, as there are no environmental ways to get an advantage. Also, Electric-type Pokemon arent that versatile compared to something like a Water-type Pokemon. In the games, Pikachu would have to sit by the sidelines more often for Ash or else he would lose a lot more frequently.

Ash Doesnt Have The Structure To Train His Pokemon Evenly

Or The Knowhow To Catch Pokemon

Players who bought the original Pokemon Red and Pokemon Blue and watched the anime must have been incredibly frustrated. As players, they learned fast to try and catch every new Pokemon that came their way. While Ash sometimes did that, a lot of the time he failed. The writers must have thought that if Ash actually tried to catch em all, he would become too OP. Beyond catching Pokemon, Ash wasnt very good at diversifying his party.

Technically, he could have battled in-between episodes to rack up EXP for his Pokemon, but its doubtful. They barely ever evolved, which is another bad form of training. Worst of all, there were episodes wherein Ash set his Pokemon go, like Butterfree. The episodes it happened in were touching, but its not a good idea to do that in the games unless players have amassed a bunch of one type of Pokemon.

Losing A Trainer Battle Means Forfeiting Money

Thats One Broke Kid

There are a lot of differences between the Pokemon games and anime. When it comes to Pokemon trainers, theres a big gap. In the anime, when Ash loses to a trainer, he doesnt have to hand over money, and vice versa.

In the games, losing to another Trainer will force players to hand over a portion of their money. This is the best way for players to earn money in return, which is very precious in the Pokemon games as opposed to other RPGs wherein monsters carry money. Given that Ash lost a lot in the anime, he would be broke in the games since there is this money factor to consider.

Team Rocket Isnt As Funny

These Goons Mean Business

Beyond wild Pokemon, Trainers, and Gym Leaders, Ash had to deal with Team Rocket. Thankfully for Ash, the team members that followed them, comprised of Jesse, Meowth, and James, were even more incompetent when it came to training Pokemon than Ash. Try as they might, they could never catch Pikachu.

There were other members that faced him in the anime too, but overall, they werent that menacing. The games are a bit different, as Team Rocket members pop up more frequently. There are other gangster teams in the game series too, like Team Galactic and Team Aqua. Its another example of how bad it would be for Ash to be alone in these frequent encounters.

8.0 /10

Pokmon
